metadata.title: Alibaba’s Main AI App Debuts Strongly in Effort to Rival ChatGPT
metadata.description: The Chinese e-commerce leader’s shares climbed more than 5% Monday in Hong Kong after Alibaba disclosed the number in a WeChat blog post.  Setting aside Meta Platforms Inc.’s Threads, which got the benefit of its parent company’s vast social networks, Alibaba’s Qwen is among the faster risers, particularly in China, where ChatGPT is unavailable.  “Whether or not they can leverage the Qwen app to drive their to-consumer business will be an important factor influencing the company’s future valuation,” said Kenny Ng, a strategist at China Everbright Securities International Co. “The market also views this move as a crucial step for benchmarking it against the valuation of OpenAI.”
